meanings.sent1: She made a misbiassed decision based on her preconceived notions.
meanings.sent2: The misbiassed report favored one side over the other.
meanings.sent3: His misbiassed view of the situation made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The misbiassed judge's ruling was like looking through a distorted lens.
meanings.sent5: The misbiassed comments left a lasting impact on the audience.

meanings.definition: to cause bias or prejudice in
meanings.sent1: The media misbiassed the public opinion with their sensational headlines.
meanings.sent2: Parents should be careful not to misbiass their children against certain beliefs.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to misbiass the jury backfired spectacularly.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech misbiassed the listeners towards his opponent.
meanings.sent5: The misleading advertisement misbiassed consumers into buying unnecessary products.

meanings.sent1: The misbiassed comments were hurtful to many people.
meanings.sent2: She avoided making misbiassed remarks during the debate.
meanings.sent3: The misbiassed group refused to consider any other perspective.
meanings.sent4: His misbiassed attitude created tension within the team.
meanings.sent5: The misbiassed behavior was not tolerated in the workplace.
